Class Hierarchy

  • object: The most base type
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.EPS.Balance: EPS type of balancing used for non-Hermitian problems
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.PEP.Basis
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.BV.BlockType: BV block-orthogonalization types
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.FN.CombineType: FN type of combination of child functions
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.EPS.Conv: EPS convergence test
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.PEP.Conv: PEP convergence test

    • slepc4py.SLEPc.NEP.ConvergedReason
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.SVD.ErrorType: SVD error type to assess accuracy of computed solutions
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.NEP.ErrorType: NEP error type to assess accuracy of computed solutions
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.EPS.ErrorType: EPS error type to assess accuracy of computed solutions
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.PEP.ErrorType: PEP error type to assess accuracy of computed solutions
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.PEP.Extract: Extraction strategy used to obtain eigenvectors of the PEP from the eigenvectors of the linearization
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.EPS.Extraction: EPS extraction technique
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.EPS.LanczosReorthogType: EPS Lanczos reorthogonalization type
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.ST.MatMode: ST matrix mode
    • slepc4py.SLEPc.DS.MatType: To refer to one of the matrices stored internally in DS

    • slepc4py.SLEPc.NEP.Refine: NEP refinement strategy
